name: Doctor Alvarez

topics.response_text: This had better be good. You have a lot to answer for.

topics.topic_text: This is Veronica, formerly of the Brotherhood of Steel. She's interested in joining your cause.
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood? Well, this is unusual, I must say. But very welcome.
I'm afraid I'm not that kind of doctor. I'm a research scientist.
Possibly, but I'd be the wrong person to ask. You'll need to speak to Dr. Schiller, who's on an errand at one of our other stations.
This is just a site for local Followers to pick up assignments and check in.
No. We don't expect him back until tomorrow.

description:
Dr. Alvarez is a 48 year-old Hispanic Female.

Dr. Alvarez is a middle-aged Hispanic woman with kind eyes and a thoughtful demeanor. As a research scientist for the Followers of the Apocalypse, she wears practical clothing with a lab coat over her simple attire. Her hands show signs of both meticulous laboratory work and practical field experience. She speaks with a calm, measured tone, reflecting her years of dedicated research.

Dr. Alvarez's Personality: Dr. Alvarez is compassionate, patient, and deeply committed to the Followers' mission of preserving knowledge and helping others. She approaches problems methodically and values intellectual curiosity. Despite her academic background, she remains grounded and practical, understanding the harsh realities of the wasteland. She can be occasionally stubborn when defending her research methods but is always open to new ideas that align with the Followers' goals.

Dr. Alvarez's Backstory: Born in the ruins of Los Angeles before it became the hub of the New California Republic, Dr. Alvarez grew up in a small settlement that valued knowledge above all else. Her parents were teachers in the pre-War sense, preserving books and teaching children to read in the chaotic early years after the Great War. She showed an aptitude for science from a young age and was eventually taken in by the Followers of the Apocalypse, who recognized her potential. After years of training and research at their main bunker in Los Angeles, she requested a field assignment and was sent to the Mojave Wasteland outpost to study local flora, fauna, and medical conditions unique to the region.
